plugins.name: MAPPE — Mini map for Figma
plugins.description:
The figma area (if we take the entire canvas) is 262,000 x 262,000 pixels. If there are few screens and they are small, you do not think about the actual canvas size. But when there are a lot of layouts, at some point you run into the edge of the canvas. At this point, you understand that it becomes impossible to navigate in figma.


MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.tagline: Easy navigation through large figma files

plugins.name: BulkGen
plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing — don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that
  2. Certificates: Automate 1000s of certificates in just a few clicks
  3. Wedding Invites: Mail Merge is so oldschool, just use this.
  4. And Many More.


Website: https://bulkgen.app

Help docs: https://ybnco.notion.site/BulkGen-Help-Docs-1905dc1b35f980f0becbe647dfae68d4

Email me: yb@yashbhardwaj.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Figma Designs From Google Sheets/CSV

plugins.name: Grid Counter
plugins.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. To use, simply select an element inside a frame with a layout grid, and the plugin will display the number of columns or rows it spans. It updates in real-time as you select different elements. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep – your personal cleanup assistant in Figma
plugins.tagline: Unveil and Tidy: Your Hidden Layer Ally

plugins.name: Collect and Rename
plugins.description:
Collect and Rename allows users to easily collect text elements from a design document, rename them, and navigate to specific layers on different pages.


Main features:


1. Collection of text elements:

- The plugin automatically collects all text elements in the document.

2. Renaming texts:

- Ability to rename text layers directly in the plugin interface.

- After renaming, text layers are updated in real time.

3. Layer navigation:

- Ability to navigate to a specific layer, even if it is on a different page of the document.



How to use the plugin:


1. Installation and launch:

- Install the "Collect and Rename" plugin from the Figma Community.

- Open your project in Figma and launch the plugin through the "Plugins" menu.

2. Text collection:

- The plugin will automatically collect all text elements from the current document and display them in the interface.

3. Renaming texts:

- In the plugin interface, you will see a list of all text layers.

- For each text element:

- "Current text" shows the current text of the layer.

- "New text" provides a field for entering new text.

- Enter the new text in the "New text" field and press "Apply" or the Enter key to confirm.

- The layer text will be updated, and you will see a notification about a successful update.

4. Navigation to layers:

- Click on the text field of the layer to automatically navigate to it in the document, even if it is on a different page.

5. Closing the plugin:

- Close the plugin when you finish your work by pressing the "Close" button in the plugin interface.
plugins.tagline: The plugin shows all text layers in a list, making it easy to replace text.

plugins.name: Smart Rename
plugins.description:
Smart Rename is a powerful Figma plugin built to streamline your workflow by letting you bulk rename frames customizable base names and smart suffixes like version numbers, dimensions, or sequence numbers.


It also fixes a common frustration in UI design: decimal positioning. When frames have non-integer X or Y values, exported assets often end up with unwanted white lines or blurry edges. Smart Rename solves this by auto-aligning frames to the nearest whole pixel, ensuring clean, sharp exports every time.


From organization to export-readiness, this plugin saves time and eliminates manual, error-prone tasks—all in a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Bulk rename and align Figma frames in seconds. Add version, size, or number suffixes effortlessly.

plugins.name: Usably
plugins.description:
Usably: Instant UX Feedback Powered by AI


Get actionable insights to improve usability, accessibility, and visual consistency—all without needing an API key!


This plugin analyzes your design against core UX principles like Hick's Law, Jakob's Law, and more.


How It Works:

  1. Select an area: Choose a single frame or an entire flow with multiple frames.
  2. Click "Review Design": Start the analysis with just one click.
  3. Get feedback: Usably generates comprehensive, actionable feedback to refine your design.


Key Features:

✅ Easy setup: NO API key needed - Install the plugin, sign up with your email, and start reviewing in seconds.

✅ Advanced UX analysis: Incorporates proven UX laws for better design decisions.


The subscription and payment of the plugin is managed by Figma marketplace. You can follow their help center to unsubscribe.


🦄 Free plan includes 5 reviews, paid subscription includes 100 reviews per month.


💌 Need help? Reach out to the Usably team at usably.team@gmail.com.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered UX reviews with insights—no API key needed. Install and start improving your designs!

plugins.name: Companion
plugins.description:
Advanced Color Finder [PRO Feature]

A powerful tool that allows you to search for colors across your files.

  1. Ultra-fast search algorithm with advanced labeling
  2. Colors are grouped by type (variable or style) and by source (Remote or local libraries)
  3. Ability to search by variable name, color hex and by layer name
  4. Display number of matching results per color
  5. Select all or individual layers that matches the selected color


Style Guide Generator [Free]

  1. Transform your color collections into a beautiful style guide
  2. Choose one or more color formats to display (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  3. Support for cross-collections linked variables


Contrast Checker [Free]

  1. Check for AA and AAA level compliance
  2. Interactive and instant results when adjusting colors
  3. Live preview and swap foreground and background colors
  4. Get results for for text (Small / Large) and graphics elements


Tints & Shades Generator [Free]

  1. Interactive generator with live colors preview
  2. Ability to customize the number of generated colors
  3. Built-in contrast checker
  4. Preview generated colors on canvas
  5. Save generated colors to variables


Color Converter [Free]

  1. Convert any given color to popular color formats
  2. Currently supports HEX, RGB, HSL, CMYK, HSV, OKLCH and LAB
  3. Select and copy results


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


Sort Layers [Free]

A set of different ways to sort your layers within Figma.

  1. Alphabetical sorting (A-Z or Z-A)
  2. Sort by X or Y position on the canvas
  3. Sort by layer type (Frame, text, group, section, etc…)
  4. Reverse current sorting
  5. Magically sort everything based on names and positions


Distribute Layers [Free]

A powered up version of Figma’s built-in distribute feature.

  1. Distribute selected layers horizontally or vertically
  2. Set a desired value for the space between layers
  3. Ability to align layers from top (in horizontal mode) or left (in vertical mode)


Display As Grid [Free]

Quickly rearrange selected layers in a grid layout with improved alignment and sorting features

  1. Ability to choose the number of columns along with vertical and horizontal gaps
  2. Ability to align columns vertically or not
  3. Extra sorting capabilities for better organization


Hidden Layers [PRO Feature]

Simple yet powerful tool to bulk manage hidden layers. It allows you to

  1. Hide selected layers
  2. Show all hidden layers within a page or within a selection
  3. Select all hidden layers within a page or within a selection
  4. Delete all hidden layers within a page or within a selection


Locked Layers [Free]

Simple yet powerful tool to bulk manage locked layers. It allows you to

  1. Lock or unlock selected layers
  2. Lock or unlock all layers on a page


Remove Numbers [PRO Feature]

Get rid of all those annoying numbers that Figma automatically generates. A single click gets the job done


Ungroup Single Layers Group [PRO Feature]

Optimize your files by ungrouping single layers group or deleting empty groups


Start at 0, 0 [PRO Feature]

It’s just the cherry on top. A file is never tidy unless you start at 0, 0 — and for that, we got you covered


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


Deep Search [PRO Feature]

Deep Search is a unique and ultra-fast way to find any layer within your file, in a simple yet powerful search tool. The search algorithm has been thoroughly optimized for speed, especially for large files.


Below is how it works:

  1. Start by selecting the layer type (Frame, text, rectangle, etc.) or choose “All Layers” to search everything
  2. Choose one or more properties to search for (Fill color, width, font, opacity and many many more). You can also use the Quick Search box to search for any property from the list for easier access
  3. Hit the search button and voilà. Results are there.
  4. Browse the list of matching search results, with ability to filter by layer name.
  5. Click on a result to view it on the canvas or click “Select All” to bulk select all matching results


Here are some example scenarios:

  1. [Simple] ― Find all text layers with the font “Inter” and font weight “Semi Bold”
  2. [Simple] ― Find all rectangles with a corner radius of 16 and corner smoothing of 60%
  3. [Medium] ― Find all instances of a component named “Button” that are hidden and have been detached
  4. [Medium] ― Find all auto layouts that have a minimum width of at least 393px
  5. [Advanced] ― Find all instances of an external library component named “Input” that are marked as ready for dev and whose top left corner radius is less than or equal to 20px
  6. [Advanced] ― Find all layers that have a hidden stroke, have a blend mode applied and whose name include the characters “es”


In short, the possibilities are endless


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


MagiConnect [PRO Feature]

MagiConnect is a simple and easy to use tool that allows you to draw connectors between your frames


Here are some key features:

  1. Auto-draw mode: When enabled, it allows you to quickly draw connectors between any two elements you select on the canvas. The direction of the connector arrow is based on the selection order
  2. Manual mode was designed to give you more flexibility in accessing nested layers before drawing a connector. It’s slower for sure, but gives you more control
  3. You can customize the connector by adjusting the color, opacity, stroke width, radius and stroke style
  4. If you’re not happy with the connector customizations, you can always reset all values to their default state from the manage menu
  5. You can also add an optional description to annotate the connector
  6. The tool will always remember your last used settings whenever it’s launched the next time.
  7. You can update specific connectors within a selection or update globally across a page
  8. In cases where a fresh start is the way to go, simple go to “Manage” and select “Remove all connectors”. This will delete all connectors you’ve added on this page


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


When you purchase the license, you will get a lifetime unlimited access to the plugin, and all to the upcoming features that i’m planning to add. Some really exciting features are coming soon. This is truly the beginning.


Due to limitations from Figma, you can only access PRO features from the account you purchased the license on. You will not be able to access PRO features from connected accounts and must purchase the license again if you want to use it on another account.


Future releases of the plugin might not be at the current price tag.


If you made it this far, I salute you for your patience.


For any questions, ideas, bugs or complaints, I would love to hear from you. Please feel free to reach out.


Built with ❤️
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one plugin you never knew you needed

―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


MagiConnect [PRO Feature]

MagiConnect is a simple and easy to use tool that allows you to draw connectors between your frames


Here are some key features:

  1. Auto-draw mode: When enabled, it allows you to quickly draw connectors between any two elements you select on the canvas. The direction of the connector arrow is based on the selection order
  2. Manual mode was designed to give you more flexibility in accessing nested layers before drawing a connector. It’s slower for sure, but gives you more control
  3. You can customize the connector by adjusting the color, opacity, stroke width, radius and stroke style
  4. If you’re not happy with the connector customizations, you can always reset all values to their default state from the manage menu
  5. You can also add an optional description to annotate the connector
  6. The tool will always remember your last used settings whenever it’s launched the next time.
  7. You can update specific connectors within a selection or update globally across a page
  8. In cases where a fresh start is the way to go, simple go to “Manage” and select “Remove all connectors”. This will delete all connectors you’ve added on this page


―――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――――


When you purchase the license, you will get a lifetime unlimited access to the plugin, and all to the upcoming features that i’m planning to add. Some really exciting features are coming soon. This is truly the beginning.


Due to limitations from Figma, you can only access PRO features from the account you purchased the license on. You will not be able to access PRO features from connected accounts and must purchase the license again if you want to use it on another account.


Future releases of the plugin might not be at the current price tag.


If you made it this far, I salute you for your patience.


For any questions, ideas, bugs or complaints, I would love to hear from you. Please feel free to reach out.


Built with ❤️

plugins.name: Rename From Sublayer
plugins.description:
Rename from sublayers simplifies the process of renaming groups in Figma by automatically detecting image, text or shape layers within selected groups.


You can choose between five modes: image detection, text layer, Rectangle layer, ellipse layer and symbols detection.

Additionally, you can opt to rename all child groups within the hierarchy or just the top-level group, giving you full control over your naming conventions.


Key Features:

  1. Image, Text, Shape Detection: Automatically rename groups based on image names, text names, rectangle names, ellipse names and symbols.
  2. Selective Renaming: Choose to rename just the highest-level group or all nested child groups.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: Simple and intuitive UI to quickly toggle between options.


Whether you're managing large design systems or working on a small project, Rename from sublayers helps keep your layers organized and your workflow efficient.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly rename groups by image, text or shape layers.

plugins.name: PinNote
plugins.description:
Comunique com clareza. Colabore com eficiência.

Com o PinNote, você pode adicionar notas diretamente nos elementos do design. Cada nota pode ser classificada por categorias inteligentes como Acessibilidade, Desenvolvimento, Interações, Bug Report, Regra de Negócio, entre outras. Cada categoria oferece recursos específicos, como trechos de código, mensagens para leitores de tela, descrição de interações e links.


O plugin também permite criar categorias personalizadas com ícones e cores definidas por você! As notas são organizadas automaticamente, com posicionamento inteligente e numeração visual, facilitando a leitura mesmo em arquivos complexos.



Para quem é esse plugin?

O PinNote foi criado para:

  1. Product Designers que querem entregar projetos mais claros, documentados e colaborativos.
  2. UX/UI Designers que precisam deixar orientações específicas sobre interações, regras de negócio e acessibilidade.
  3. Desenvolvedores que desejam encontrar rapidamente tudo o que precisam para implementar uma interface com fidelidade.
  4. Líderes de produto e stakeholders que querem acompanhar decisões de design com transparência.
  5. Times multidisciplinares que buscam reduzir fricções no processo de handoff e ganhar eficiência.



FAQ - Perguntas Frequentes

Como faço para mover uma nota depois de criada?

R: As notas podem ser movidas normalmente como qualquer outro elemento do Figma. Basta selecionar e arrastar para a nova posição. O indicador numérico permanecerá vinculado ao elemento original.


É possível editar uma nota existente?

R: Sim, basta dar duplo clique na nota para abrir o modo de edição. Você pode modificar título, descrição, código e outros campos. A tag principal não pode ser alterada para manter a consistência.


Como funciona a numeração automática?

R: A numeração é sequencial por elemento. Quando você habilita a numeração, o plugin mantém um contador global e atribui o próximo número disponível. A numeração persiste mesmo se você deletar notas intermediárias.


As cores das tags são personalizáveis?

R: Cada tag tem uma cor padrão otimizada para legibilidade, mas elas podem ser alteradas de acordo com as preferências do usuário. As tags estão definidas por default como:

- Acessibilidade: #00EEFF

- Desenvolvimento: #55EF71

- Nota: #F9E444

- Alterações: #FF9925

- Regra de negócio: #CD79F4

- Interações: #FF5959

- Bug report: #FF59C8


Existe um limite de notas por elemento?

R: Não há limite técnico, mas por questões de organização e legibilidade, recomendamos não criar mais que 3-4 notas por elemento.


Como as notas são organizadas quando há várias no mesmo elemento?

R: O plugin posiciona as notas automaticamente, primeiro tentando à direita e depois abaixo das notas existentes, mantendo um espaçamento de 16px entre elas.


O plugin funciona com componentes do Figma?

R: Sim, o plugin funciona com qualquer elemento selecionável do Figma, incluindo componentes, instâncias, grupos e frames.


Outros usuários podem ver minhas notas?

R: Sim, as notas são visíveis para todos que têm acesso ao arquivo do Figma. O nome do autor e timestamp são preservados para manter o histórico.


É possível comentar em notas existentes?

R: Atualmente não há sistema de comentários nas notas, mas você pode usar o sistema de comentários nativo do Figma para discutir sobre uma nota específica ou editar o conteúdo da nota.


Posso criar tags personalizadas?

R: Sim, usando a opção "Personalizado" você pode definir sua própria cor e ícone para a tag. As configurações são salvas para reutilização.


Quais idiomas o PinNote suporta?

R: O PinNote possui suporte para os idiomas português (padrão), inglês e espanhol, permitindo que você utilize o plugin no idioma que preferir.


Posso desativar a exibição do nome do autor e da data nas notas?

R: Sim! É possível ocultar o nome do autor e a data de criação das notas através do botão mais opções, deixando a visualização mais limpa conforme sua necessidade.


Dá para desativar a criação dos marcadores numéricos nas notas?

R: Sim, você pode desativar a criação dos indicadores, através do botão mais opções, para que as notas fiquem sem numeração visual, caso prefira um layout mais simples.


Como personalizar as cores das tags?

R: Você pode escolher cores diferentes das definidas por padrão para as tags. O PinNote sugere cores acessíveis, alinhadas às diretrizes WCAG, para garantir boa legibilidade. Além disso, é possível inserir qualquer cor personalizada usando códigos hexadecimais, acessando a opção “mais cores”.
plugins.tagline: Facilite a comunicação no Figma com notas visuais que destacam informações importantes no seu design

plugins.name: IconBridge – Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHub—seamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



✨ Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export – Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration – Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation – IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access – Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




🚀 How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export Icons” on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click “Save” to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export to GitHub” to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




🛠️ What You’ll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




🔒 Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integration—no external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflow—eliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


🚀 Forget tedious icon management—let IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
plugins.tagline: Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Countastic
plugins.description:
Countastic is the ultimate Figma calculator plugin, built to help product designers create data-centric products and screens faster and more efficiently.


Add, subtract, calculate averages and percentages automatically and use them in your designs with a single click, making the data on screen believable and relevant to your customers, stakeholders and usability test participants.


A must have for any designer sweating the details of data tables, sales and analytics dashboards, finance or e-commerce products.


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Get started

Countastic performs calculations on objects selected in your Figma file, showing you results you can copy or place on the canvas with a single click.


Open Countastic and:

  1. Select two or more text objects in your Figma file
  2. See the sum, difference, average and percentage difference of the selected objects.
  3. Click the result of a calculation to copy to clipboard
  4. Click the “Place” button beside the calculation to add the result to the canvas


Countastic works with:

  1. Currencies (including US, UK and European separator and decimal point styles)
  2. Units of measure
  3. Any numerical values containing prefixes or suffixes


Countastic helps you calculate:

  1. Sums
  2. Differences
  3. Averages
  4. Percentage differences (between 2 objects only)


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Questions and feedback

Countastic requires no setup, allowing you to hit the ground running and use relevant, real-looking data in your designs.


If you have feedback about Countastic or want to share an idea or a feature request, drop me a line on X, Bluesky or Threads.

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

124974.description:

plugins.name: Link Manager
plugins.description:
Figma でのリンク管理に悩んでいませんか？


デザイン内のリンクが散らばっていて、手作業で整理するのが大変…。

Link Manager を使えば、リンクの検出・削除が数クリックで完了！

リンクの整理をもっと簡単に。スッキリとしたデザイン管理 を実現しましょう！🚀


Managing links in Figma can be frustrating—especially when working on large projects with scattered hyperlinks.


With Link Manager, you can effortlessly find, copy, and remove links from your Figma files in just a few clicks.


No more clutter, no more manual cleanups. Keep your designs neat, organized, and efficient with this powerful yet easy-to-use plugin! 🚀


🔹 主な機能 | Key Features


✅ 🔍 自動リンク検出 | Auto-Detect Hyperlinks – 選択したフレーム内の すべてのリンクを瞬時にリストアップ

✅ 🗑 簡単なリンク削除 | Easy Link Removal – 選択したリンクを削除 or すべてのリンクを一括削除

✅ 🌍 多言語対応 | Multi-language Support – 英語 & 日本語 に対応



🔹 使い方 | How to Use


🇯🇵 日本語

1️⃣ 「Detect Links」 をクリック → デザイン内のリンクをリストアップ

2️⃣ 「Remove Selected」 で 選択したリンクを削除

3️⃣ 「Remove All」 ですべてのリンクを一括削除


💡 Figma 内のリンク管理をスマートに！


🇬🇧 English

1️⃣ Click “Detect Links” to scan your Figma file for all hyperlinks

2️⃣ Select specific links and click “Remove Selected” to delete them

3️⃣ Click “Remove All” to erase every hyperlink from your design


💡 Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!



🎯 こんな方におすすめ | Who is This Plugin For?


🇯🇵 日本語

🔹 デザイナー - Figma ファイルを整理したい

120806.name: Link Manager
120806.description:
Figma でのリンク管理に悩んでいませんか？


デザイン内のリンクが散らばっていて、手作業で整理するのが大変…。

Link Manager を使えば、リンクの検出・削除が数クリックで完了！

リンクの整理をもっと簡単に。スッキリとしたデザイン管理 を実現しましょう！🚀


Managing links in Figma can be frustrating—especially when working on large projects with scattered hyperlinks.


With Link Manager, you can effortlessly find, copy, and remove links from your Figma files in just a few clicks.


No more clutter, no more manual cleanups. Keep your designs neat, organized, and efficient with this powerful yet easy-to-use plugin! 🚀


🔹 主な機能 | Key Features


✅ 🔍 自動リンク検出 | Auto-Detect Hyperlinks – 選択したフレーム内の すべてのリンクを瞬時にリストアップ

✅ 🗑 簡単なリンク削除 | Easy Link Removal – 選択したリンクを削除 or すべてのリンクを一括削除

✅ 🌍 多言語対応 | Multi-language Support – 英語 & 日本語 に対応



🔹 使い方 | How to Use


🇯🇵 日本語

1️⃣ 「Detect Links」 をクリック → デザイン内のリンクをリストアップ

2️⃣ 「Remove Selected」 で 選択したリンクを削除

3️⃣ 「Remove All」 ですべてのリンクを一括削除


💡 Figma 内のリンク管理をスマートに！


🇬🇧 English

1️⃣ Click “Detect Links” to scan your Figma file for all hyperlinks

2️⃣ Select specific links and click “Remove Selected” to delete them

3️⃣ Click “Remove All” to erase every hyperlink from your design


💡 Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Lock All Ratios
plugins.description:
### Features


Base on the new official figma feature Aspect Ratio Locked


- 🖼️ **Batch Operations**: Lock/unlock aspect ratios of multiple images with one click

- 🔍 **Smart Filtering**:

- Filter by ratio: Quickly find images with the same aspect ratio

- Filter by lock state: Easily distinguish between locked and unlocked images

- 👀 **Preview Features**:

- Thumbnail previews

- Display image dimensions and ratios

- Click to locate images on canvas

- 🌐 **Bilingual**: Supports both English and Chinese interfaces


### Use Cases

- When maintaining consistent image ratios

- Processing large numbers of image resources

- Organizing and checking image ratios

- Quickly locating images with specific ratios


### How to Use

1. Select images to process

2. Use top filters to filter images as needed

3. Operate individually or in batch

4. Click image thumbnails or names to locate them on canvas


### Quick Operations

- Select/Deselect All: Use the checkbox in the table header

- Quick Filter: Use the ratio and lock state filters at the top

- Batch Operations: Use "Lock All"/"Unlock All" buttons in the bottom toolbar

- Refresh List: Use the refresh button in the bottom toolbar


---


基于 figma 新发布的 “图片比例锁定” 功能开发


### 功能特点

- 🖼️ **批量操作**：一键锁定/解锁多个图片的宽高比

- 🔍 **智能筛选**：

- 按比例筛选：快速找到相同比例的图片

- 按锁定状态筛选：轻松区分已锁定和未锁定的图片

- 👀 **预览功能**：

- 缩略图预览

- 显示图片尺寸和比例

- 点击可快速定位到画布中的图片

- 🌐 **双语支持**：支持中文和英文界面


### 使用场景

- 需要保持多个图片比例一致时

- 批量处理大量图片资源时

- 整理和检查图片比例时

- 快速定位特定比例的图片


### 使用方法

1. 选择要处理的图片

2. 使用顶部筛选器按需过滤图片

3. 可以单个操作，也可以批量选择后操作

4. 点击图片缩略图或名称可快速定位到画布中的图片


### 快捷操作

- 全选/取消全选：使用表格顶部的复选框

- 快速筛选：使用顶部的比例和锁定状态筛选器

- 批量操作：使用底部工具栏的 " 锁定全部 "/" 解锁全部 " 按钮

- 刷新列表：使用底部工具栏的刷新按钮

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.name: MagicText
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by recognizing, transforming, and cleaning up text layers in seconds. Whether you're extracting text from images, converting case styles, or refining typography, this tool enhances productivity and ensures design consistency with just a few clicks.


How It Works:


1. Text Recognition

Use the built-in text recognize to quickly extract text from image layers. Simply select an image layer, choose the desired language, and launch text recognition – the plugin will automatically create a new text layer with the extracted content.

Supported Languages: MagicText supports a wide range of languages: English, Chinese, Ukrainian, Spanish, German, French, Japanese, Korean, Arabic, Portuguese, Italian, Bulgarian, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Turkish and more.


2. Text Transformation:

Easily change the case of your text with a single click:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize the first letter of each word.
  2. Sentence Case: Capitalize only the first letter of each sentence.
  3. UPPERCASE & lowercase: Convert your text to all uppercase or all lowercase letters.


3. Text Manipulation:

Seamlessly merge multiple text layers into one or split a single text layer into individual sentences for easier editing.


4. Style Cleanup:

  1. Remove Hyperlinks: Automatically strip out hyperlinks from your text.
  2. Remove All Styles: Reset text and color styles, reverting your text to a clean, default appearance.


5. Character Counter:

Instantly see the number of characters, sentences, and words in your selected text layers for precise text management.


Key Features:

  1. Image-Based Text Recognition: Extract text from images with support for multiple languages.
  2. Case Conversion Options: Transform text to sentence case, title case, UPPERCASE, or lowercase in just a few clicks.
  3. Text Layer Manipulation: Merge and split text layers effortlessly to suit your workflow.
  4. Style Reset: Remove hyperlinks and reset text formatting to maintain consistency in your designs.
  5. Real-Time Character Counting: Keep track of characters, sentences, and words in real time.


Who Is It For?

MagicText is designed for Figma designers who want to streamline their text formatting and editing process. By automating repetitive tasks and offering powerful text transformation tools, MagicText allows you to focus more on creative design and less on manual text adjustments.


Feedback & Future Updates

Welcome your professional insights and suggestions for improvements. Your feedback is invaluable and will be carefully reviewed to guide future updates. Please share your ideas and help us enhance MagicText. Leave your feedback here.
plugins.tagline: Recognize, transform, and clean text layers instantly—enhancing productivity and consistency.

plugins.name: Text to Frame Name
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Text to Frame Name” is a handy tool that allows you to replace selected text with the name of the highest-level frame it belongs to, all at once. This is particularly useful for page numbers in presentation materials or proposals. For example, you can set frame names with sequential numbers like “01,” “02,” and “03,” place temporary text (e.g., “00”) on each page, select all the text, and run this plugin to complete page numbering. Even if you reorder or add pages, you can easily reset the numbers by simply modifying the frame names. This eliminates the need for manual number adjustments, significantly improving workflow efficiency.


Figmaプラグイン「Text to Frame Name」は、選択したテキストを、それぞれが属する最上位のフレーム名に一括で置き換えることができる便利なツールです。主にプレゼンテーション資料や提案書などのページ番号で役立ちます。たとえば「01」「02」「03」など連番がついたフレーム名にしておき、各ページに仮のテキスト（例：00）を配置し、すべてのテキストを選択してこのプラグインを実行するだけで、ページ番号制作が完了します。ページを入れ替えたり追加したりしても、フレーム名さえ修正すれば簡単に番号を再設定可能。手動で番号を修正する必要がなくなり、作業効率が大きく向上します。
plugins.tagline: Auto-convert text layers to parent frame names

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

plugins.name: Image Generator with Component & Google Spreadsheet
plugins.description:
A powerful plugin that automatically generates Figma component-based images using data from Google Spreadsheets. Save time on projects requiring large volumes of design assets. Simply input your data into a spreadsheet, select your desired component templates, and generate hundreds of images with just one click. Streamline your design workflow by automating repetitive design tasks such as banners, social media posts, product catalogs, and more.


Google 스프레드시트의 데이터를 활용하여 Figma 컴포넌트 기반 이미지를 자동으로 생성하는 강력한 플러그인입니다. 대량의 디자인 에셋이 필요한 프로젝트에서 시간을 절약하세요. 스프레드시트에 데이터를 입력하고, 원하는 컴포넌트 템플릿을 선택한 다음, 버튼 한 번으로 수백 개의 이미지를 생성할 수 있습니다. 배너, 소셜 미디어 포스트, 제품 카탈로그 등 반복적인 디자인 작업을 자동화하여 디자인 워크플로우를 혁신하세요.
plugins.tagline: Generate images from your Google Sheets with powerful component integration

plugins.name: MultiText Inserter
plugins.description:
MultiText Inserter helps you quickly create multiple text fields in your designs all at once. Instead of adding each text box one by one, you can enter all your text at once, set the font size, color, and style, and the plugin will generate all the text fields for you automatically. It's a real time-saver for designers who need to add lists of text elements.


Example of Footer Content:


"About Us"

"Contact"

"Privacy Policy"

"Terms of Service"

"© 2023 Your Company Name"

You can input these lines into the plugin, and it will create individual text fields for each item, styled according to your settings.

accepted.name: Muhiris
accepted.description: Love getting paid for something I do for fun.

plugins.tagline: Multitext Inserter to save time and make you productive

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

•Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
•Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
•Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

•Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays “Select an Option” and is disabled. When the user selects either “Sections” or “Frames,” the text changes to “Convert,” and the button becomes enabled.
•Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

•Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When “Sections” or “Frames” is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
•Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

•Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.
